entry.title: Jian LIU (刘坚)
entry.content:
About me

I am a PhD student at the Hong Kong Polytechnic University. My research interest focuses on human behaviors, urban dynamics, and complex networks. Leveraging multi-source big data and advanced technologies, my research aims to advance the livability and inclusiveness of smart cities.

Education

  • 2024.05~: PhD in Urban Informatics and Smart City
    Department of Land Surveying and Geo-Informatics, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University

  • 2022.11~2024.04: Research Assistant
    Department of Land Surveying and Geo-Informatics, The Hong Kong Polytechnic University

  • 2019.9~2022.06: MSc in Human Geography
    College of Resource Environment and Tourism, Capital Normal University

  • 2015.9~2019.06: BSc in Human Geography and Urban-rural Planning
    College of Geography and Environmental Science, Northwest Normal University

Research interests

  • Human mobility (travel behaviors & activity space)
  • Urban informatics (big data analytics & applications)
  • Urban systems (urban structure & complex networks)

Featured publications

  • Liu, J., Meng, B., & Shi, C. (2023). A multi-activity view of intra-urban travel networks: a case study of Beijing. Cities, 143, 104634.
  • Liu, J., Meng, B., Yang, M., Peng, X., Zhan, D., & Zhi, G. (2022). Quantifying spatial disparities and influencing factors of home, work, and activity space separation in Beijing. Habitat International, 126, 102621.
  • Liu, H., Liu, J., Li, M., Gou, P., & Cheng, Y. (2022). Assessing the evolution of PM2. 5 and related health impacts resulting from air quality policies in China. Environmental Impact Assessment Review, 93, 106727. (Corresponding author)
